intro: Centaurea amara proles approximata, commonly known as the bitter centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its spiny, reddish stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Centaurea amara proles approximata is known for its bitter taste and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
